sense.name: Make more even or free from obstructions.
sense.commentary: Includes: SMOOTH OUT Syntas is: NP1[agent] SMOOTH (out) NP2[patient] NOTE: Includes metaphorical uses.
sense.examples: Smooth the surface of the wood with sandpaper, please. John smoothed the icing on the cake. We smoothed out the gravel with a rake. The President has done little to smooth the way towards peace negotiations. We must smooth out this journey for one another.

sense.name: SMOOTH OVER: make less emotionally intense; make peace.
sense.examples: The President tried to smooth things over a few days later, but to no avail. Try to smooth things over with your sister before the car ride please.
